title: Guidelines on a Systematic Decision
segmentation: Thank you, chairman, for this introduction.
Ladies and gentlemen, good afternoon.
The introduction about this work in the work desk free you got from mozza.
And from Laslo we prepare some special guidelines.
Very complicated.
Title, but the guidelines are very simple.
The presentation the contents you have here on the screen.
First of all, I will say a few words about the road network and Rd quality in the countries of Central and Eastern Europe, then towards about the project objective.
Then a special questioner that was prepared.
Assessment of the condition of payment structures.
Then the goal of this work, the methodology for systematic determining measures.
Then I will present you 2 examples and then a few words about rehabilitation and technical procedures until the end.
Conclusion.

In the last 15 years in the countries of certain and Eastern Europe's, the most energy was put to the main roads and to motorways to build new roads and so on, and so a lot of problems we have on the existing Rd network.
For example in Slovenia we have about 6000 national roads and about 3000 kilometers are in bed pavements condition.
He receives some crocodile cracks, load bearing capacity, not good illness and so on.
So the goal of the project was to prepare a simple methodology for determining measures on Rd with smaller traffic volumes.
All low traffic volume we ask in our group ourselves what are roads with low traffic volume?
And we looked for some technical definitions, but we didn't find some definition.
So we decided in the group to say.
Let's say that low volume roads are roads with less than 300 passes of ASL standard extra load of 100 kilometer, and this was so their methodology was prepared for this traffic.
But in general it works also for heavier traffic participant countries in this group, where from Poland, Slovakia, Czech Republic, Hungary, and Slovenia.
And total length of roads in this country is in rough about 300,000 of kilometers.

For local roads you see that at motorways and main roads the most traffic in percentages.
Higher traffic load is higher than 300 SL of 100K.
Newton and.
Opposite in regional and local roads.
The traffic load is slower and so all this this procedure that we prepare is focusing to all these routes in kilometer.
The most of them.
Of course you can see here also that for the local roads the data are not available about traffic loads, so so we don't have the moment this data.
As I said before, we prepared in this work package special questioner, it was necessary to see how different countries deal with this.
So we prepare.
I will briefly go across this question.
Are what kind of information we collect.
First of all, the data about the road networks in different countries.
Then data about traffic, the density, traffic loading?
What is the permitted weight in different countries and what is the permitted excellent?

Kind of equipment for assessment of the pavement conditions.

The methodology works by iteration.
First of all, you need pavement condition.
You need these five measurements and then you go from one to another and take the right solution for the pavement.

In our we decided in our group to to define the conditions from very good to very poor in five categories, and so every country has the possibility to take the right after their standard Watts for somebody very good or very poor and so on.
So it's not necessary that you take the same conditions in each country.
Everyone takes this conditions for for him.

It's transfers are illness or writing.

Concrete, then some kind of surface dressing.
Binder and then chipping.

Teen late dressing or slurry seal.
Very known technology.
The the 2nd.
This part is resurfacing to put some layer of asphalt.
You can use asphalt concrete for surf in more more important roles you wrote you can use stone mastics asphalt.
Or if you would like to have a lower voice on the road you use porous asphalt.
And the third ring.
Forcement here you can use asphalt layers.
You can use inbound material and then asphalt layers in the last.
Time very popular are recycling technologies with foam bitumen.
With warm kind of asphalt mixtures and and so on.
And so I come to the conclusion.
The methodology is useful for all kinds of pavements, but especially for low volume routes.

Other questions from the audience.
One table away.

These local roads in the overall context?

First of all, first of all, it's important.
What would you like?
Would you like to improve the quality or not?

I think at the moment it's not.

But you must take some category and say we go a step forward and make the measurements and go and go ahead.
Step by step.
OK.
